attributes.action: Death certificates to be given to parents of babies from 16 weeks
attributes.background: Please help me to change the law on registering the death of a baby from 16 weeks of pregnancy. I gave birth to my baby boy at 20 weeks pregnant. He did not breathe so I could not register him, which is not fair.
attributes.additional_details: Women who give birth to children prior to 24 weeks of pregnancy are unable to register the death of their babies. This is not fair as they are still babies and the death certificate means a lot. This is very hard for women and thousands of women have been through this. Please help me get the law changed so babies can be registered when they die.

attributes.action: NHS trusts/deaneries should make adequate provision for post-night shift rest
attributes.background: A Doctors.net.uk survey showed 41% doctors have fallen asleep after a night shift.  This is most prevalent amongst pre-consultant grade doctors, who can change hospital every 3-4 months, resulting in a long commute and no access to public transport, making night shifts inherently dangerous.
attributes.additional_details:
The need to change place of work so frequently is unique to doctors in training, and whilst other professions do have night shifts, the ensuing length of commute (average of 25 miles) increases the risk to doctors, with 29% knowing a colleague who died driving after a night shift.  Over half never have access to an on-call room with, or without a bed (52% and 57% respectively).  Only 27% had access to paid on-site accommodation.  
Source: Doctors.net.uk survey, July 2016, n=1,135

attributes.action: Include 'PELVIC PAIN' in the UK university curriculum for ALL medical students
attributes.background: Over 1 million women (and men) in this country suffer from pelvic pain.  Many suffer chronic, debilitating pain. Most struggle to find good medical care as their GPs and consultants received no education about pelvic pain during training.  Please help us make it a part of all medical training.
attributes.additional_details: I am one of those many women who suffers from chronic pelvic pain and it has devastated my life.  Leeds university is the only university to include pelvic pain in their curriculum for nurses. Healthcare professionals who suffer from pelvic pain themselves admit that they received no formal training in pelvic pain in their medical education.  The Pelvic Pain Support Network is a charity that promotes education, research and assists pelvic pain patients. Please support www.pelvicpain.org.uk

attributes.action: To introduce a law that recognizes Parental Alienation as a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Every year thousands of children will be brainwashed against the other parent with lies. this should be recognized for the crime that it is. Child Abuse and an abuse of Human rights. Children deserve the right to both parents and parents have the right to be parents.
attributes.additional_details: Please do whats in the best interests of the children. Not the alienating parent. Give the judges the power to act against parental alienation by simply making it a criminal offence.

attributes.action: Conduct independent review of recognition of Somaliland as independent country
attributes.background: We congratulate the people of Somaliland as they celebrate the 25th anniversary of reclaiming their independence; recognise the strong historical ties between Somaliland and UK; welcome the strong cooperation between UK Government and Somaliland through development aid, trade and security assistance

attributes.action: UK Government Introduce Licensing for all Air Weapons and Protect our Cats
attributes.background: The Air Weapons and Licensing (Scotland) Act 2015 comes fully into effect on 31 December 2016.  The new law will require any person who possesses, purchases, uses or acquires an air weapon to have a certificate to hold them legally. We ask that the same be introduced in England and Wales.
attributes.additional_details: Research by Feline welfare charity Cats Protection found more cats are killed in air gun attacks than 20 years ago -  In 2016 46 per cent of air gun wounds proved fatal for cats compared to 11 per cent in 1996.The findings are particularly concerning, given a leading criminologist has warned that some people who shoot cats could go on to commit similar crimes against humans. We are calling for stricter regulation on the ownership of air guns, as we strongly believe this will help to protect cats and other members of our communities from attacks.

attributes.action: Maintain the statutory role of the Supervisor of Midwives
attributes.background: Changes in the law recommended by the Kings Fund mean the statutory requirement for midwives to have a supervisor will be removed. Supervisors of midwives safeguard women and babies by ensuring excellence in midwifery practice. This recommendation would remove a vital part of public protection.
attributes.additional_details:
Supervisors of Midwives (SoM) give guidance and support to both midwives and mums to ensure that the care offered is timely and appropriate; is given in the right place; by the right person and that it will benefit the woman, baby and their family. Every hospital has a team of SoMs who are on call 24/7 to directly support women and midwives.
At time when there is clear evidence of NHS trusts prioritising financial balance ahead of quality of care this change will erode safety in maternity units

attributes.background: A call for funds to be made available to retrain all ex oil and gas workers that have been affected by been made redundant through north sea cut backs and help to find future employment and to be given grants for courses to help gain employment  like the ssi steelworkers

attributes.background: I have personally reunited a dog (scampi) after being missing for 5 years by chip checking him the owners had owned him for 2 years and he was a little girls best friend , if a vet had scanned this dog at some point it could have saved alot of heart break , sign compulsory chip checking for all vets

attributes.action: Training Paediatric Medical Professionals in Diagnosing Craniosynostosis
attributes.background: Craniosynostosis is a skull condition that causes a baby to be born with, or develop an abnormally shaped head. The irregular skull shape causes severe symptoms resulting from increased pressure in the skull, it affects 1 in every 3,000 babies born each year but is a largely unheard of condition.
attributes.additional_details: Lucy's Head Start is campaigning for mandatory training for paediatric medical professionals leading to earlier diagnosis.Families involved with Lucy's Head Start have reported that some but not all midwives, health vistors or GPs have dismissed, missed, misdiagnosed or mistaken their child's condition for flat head due to lack of awareness, which is why we desperately need mandatory training.Most children diagnosed require surgery and early intervention is vital to prevent severe symptoms.

attributes.action: Save Newholme hospital from closure
attributes.background: Bakewell will lose all its facilities at Newholme hospital under the ‘Better Care Closer to Home’ proposal made by the government. This includes rehabilitation for inpatients along with care for mental health and dementia.
attributes.additional_details:
Other services are also provided for the surrounding community including physiotherapy, podiatry, and other day care services. 
Losing this hospital with the valuable services that it provides would be a massive loss to the local people. Please help to prevent the closure by signing the petition to save Newholme hospital.

attributes.action: Ask the PM to explain the deception on the true legal status of the EU vote.
attributes.background: The Referendum was an advisory Consultation, not a binding vote. Noone neither Government nor MP's nor Civil Service, raised this fundamental point publicly before the vote. And have not confirmed it since. Why not? Was or is there a Conspiracy of Silence ordered by No. 10?
attributes.additional_details:
1.The EU Referendum Act 2015.
2. House of Commons Briefing Paper CBP-7212, June 2015, Section 5:
“Types of referendum:
This Bill ...does not contain any requirement for the UK Government to implement the results of the referendum, nor set a time limit by which a vote to leave the EU should be implemented. Instead, this is a type of referendum known as pre-legislative or consultative, which enables the electorate to voice an opinion which then influences the Government in its policy decisions."

attributes.action: Department of Transport to look into the service run by Abellio Greater Anglia.
attributes.background: Today train services were severely disrupted by overhead power cable failures. Even though Network Rail maintain these, the rolling stock is beyond fit for purpose with passengers sweltering in carriages.

attributes.action: Order a public enquiry into the PCSE Contract, and its impact on NHS services.
attributes.background: The Primary Care Support England contract was awarded to Capita by NHS England and commenced in March 2016. The service has lost countless medical records, placed services in jeopardy, and resulted in delays to junior doctors being able to start in their posts.

attributes.action: Save Bolsover Community Hospital from closure
attributes.background: Bolsover community hospital is under threat from the public services cuts imposed by the current government. We need your help in saving our hospital which provides fantastic services and relieves the pressure on the larger hospitals which are already under strain.
attributes.additional_details: Bolsover community hospital is under threat of closure from the severe cuts facing all public services. The hospital offers physiotherapy treatment and advice, intermediate care services aiming to prevent people from being admitted to hospital which is essential for all major hospitals in the current financial climate and mental health services for the elderly which are essential in any community. Bolsover has lost a lot over the years, let's not add our hospital to the ever growing list.

attributes.action: No sale or privatisation of the Land Registry.
attributes.background: Since 1862 the Land Registry has recorded the ownership of land and property in England and Wales and produces data on house prices and transactions that are used by the government to make policy decisions.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government is, once again, against professional advice, taking the first steps which will lead to a sell-off or part privatisation of the Land Registry to apparently pay down debt as if it is running a household.

The Land Registry is a highly respected and trusted institution. It is profitable. Yet the Government believes it would be better value for money if it were privatised.

We ask the Government to reconsider these ill-founded plans and preserve the Land Registry in its current form.

attributes.action: Require proof of identity to be provided by all voters in the EU Referendum.
attributes.background: More examples have been found of blatant fraud at polling stations where people who have turned up to vote are turned away having been marked as "already voted".
attributes.additional_details: These days, providing proof of identity is normal almost everywhere. Requiring proof of identity at the polling station ought to be mandatory for everyone who wants to vote, but especially in the EU Referendum, as a further guard against the fraudulent practices now rife throughout the United Kingdom and widely expected to occur during the Brexit vote.

attributes.additional_details:

Dental nurses are assisting along side Dentists who are entitled to their NHS pension so why not the nurses?

attributes.action: Give psv holders class 2 entitlement.
attributes.background: A PSV holder is a person who holds a licence to drive a bus, with this they can drive any type of bus from a minibus & double decker, right up to a bendy bus. They carry very precious cargo (the general public). But yet holders of these licences can't drive a class 2 lorry. It doesn't make sense.
attributes.additional_details:
For example,
Bus length - 12 metres,
Class 2 lorry - 7.9 metres

Bus weight - 14 ton
Class 2 lorry weight - 7.5 ton

Bus contents - passengers
Class 2 content - packages and goods

If for example you drive a bendy bus, you need similar skills to a class 1 lorry driver in relation to length and reversing. 

My argument is that psv drivers are more highly trained and skilled than a class 2 driver because of the contents and vehicle sizes, and they should automatically have class 2 entitlement.

attributes.action: Urge the Nigerian Government to stop the massacre of Igbos

attributes.additional_details: Of all these attacks, the Federal Government of Nigeria has been silence. Rather, the federal house is pushing ahead with a bill that will give the herds men full right to graze their cattle's on peoples farm lands. Similar petition is already going on and gathering signatures in the White House. attributes.action: Make it a law for vets to scan pets each time they visit.
attributes.background: I want to make it a law that all pets must be scanned when they visit the vet. This will majorly decrease the chances of lost or stolen pets slipping the net and not finding their way home. By scanning a pet each time, these pet's owners can be traced meaning many broken families can be reunited.

attributes.action: Give survivors of domestic abuse anonymous registration on Electoral Register.
attributes.background:
For survivors of domestic abuse who have been to refuge, continued anonymity can be a matter of life and death. 

The Government must change the guidance so that people who are leaving refuge are automatically offered anonymous inclusion on the Electoral Register.
attributes.additional_details:
Current guidance asks for court documents or a letter of attestation which can only be provided by:
•	a police officer of or above the rank of superintendant
•	the Director General of the Security Service (MI5) or the Serious Organised Crime Agency
•	a director of adult social services or children’s services in England 
These people are difficult for any member of the public to contact, meaning many survivors do not register at all.

Further info:
http://huff.to/1J3BGW7
http://bit.ly/1Rq6Fuh

attributes.action: Declare the 23 June EU referendum null as many UK expatriates were unrepresented
attributes.background: There are some 3 million expatriate UK citizens, equivalent to around one-tenth of the total votes cast in the referendum. Many have been denied a vote as they have been living abroad for 15 years or more. Had their votes been recognised, they could have tipped the balance in favour of Remain.
attributes.additional_details: Of an estimated 3 million expatriate UK citizens, the 1.2 million living in EU countries are those most immediately affected by Brexit, yet many of their voices have not been heard. The fact that they have not been UK-resident for 15 years should not exclude them from voting in an issue of great importance with a direct impact upon their lives. Their numbers would be sufficient to change the result in favour of Remain. The referendum should be declared null, or repeated with full representation.

attributes.action: Save Banbury Horton General Hospital From Extensive and Dangerous Cuts

Oxford University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust (OUHFT) is consulting on the way services are provided at the Horton General Hospital in Banbury
Their plans could take away A&E, consultant-led maternity, Special Care Baby Unit (SCBU), 24 hour / 7 day a week children's ward and intensive care.

That's fine if you live near by, however what happens when you live 40 minutes to an hour away from the hospital and your in need of assistance, due to either injury, sudden illness or because your in labour. attributes.action: Legislate 4 weeks paid Parental Leave for the death of a Child.
attributes.background:
Did you know that if your Child dies your employer doesn't have to give you time off from work? You can have "up to 12 months leave for the birth of a child,but just 3 days to grieve your child"
My son Jack was just 23 months old when he tragically died and I discovered this anomaly in law.
attributes.additional_details: In August 2010, my son Jack died just 2 weeks away from his 2nd birthday. I have been tirelessly trying to make a change in his memory.Grief effects us all differently, there is no wrong or right way to grieve but it should be our way in how we choose to grieve.While many good employers offer compassionate leave, there is no statutory right to leave and this needs to change.In 2014 I worked with ACAS to create guidance but still believe bereavement leave needs to be legislated.Will you Sign?

The MPs Code of Conduct obliges them to do what is best for the NATION i.e. Scotland, NI, Wales and England.If a deal which is more favourable to the whole of the UK than EU membership cannot be reached, MPs must vote not to leave.

attributes.action: Grant an amnesty to all illegal immigrants living in the UK prior to 23.06.2016.
attributes.background: Following Britain's decision to leave the EU, many people fear a significant shift to the right and violence against foreign nationals living in Britain. To prevent the victimisation of illegal immigrants by right-wing radicals, they need to have the full protection of the law as British citizens.
attributes.additional_details: Illegal immigrants are already victimised in many ways, for example by being indebted to people traffickers, enslaved as sweatshop workers, and exploited as sex workers. This situation can only worsen if Britain's exit from the EU is understood as a victory for a xenophobes and racists. Granting amnesty to illegal immigrants would provide them with a way out of their current servitude and save them from the aggression of right-wing thugs.

attributes.action: Shift Agricultural Subsidies to Support Environmental Protections post-Brexit.
attributes.background:
The government should redirect subsidies in a post-Brexit domestic agricultural policy, away from environmentally damaging farming, and towards environmental protections. 

Subsidies are needed to support farmers who tackle climate change, mitigate floods, increase biodiversity and soil health.
attributes.additional_details:
The public are understandably discouraged with the current formulation of the Common Agricultural Policy. They don’t want to see their taxes being used to line the pockets of already wealthy landowners, or to prop up failing farming industries unconditionally.

The public wants to see a domestic agricultural policy that is ahead of the curve by leading us on the path towards a low-carbon farming future, where our agricultural system provides significant benefits to the environment.

attributes.action: Members of BBC Trust should be elected by the public not appointed by government
attributes.background: The BBC Trust is the governing body of the BBC & are supposed to ensure that the BBC lives up to standards of accuracy and fairness. The Trust is responsible for approving BBC Editorial Guidelines. Currently, the Trust is appointed by the government. This should be replaced with public elections.

attributes.action: The UK government to endorse the KRG request of independence at UN level.
attributes.background: Kurdistan government has signalled it wish to get Kurdistan region of Iraq to became an independent state. To achieve it, it will need countries such as UK to endorse and support this wish as well as assist in advocating it.
attributes.additional_details: The Kurdistan regional government has demonstrated incredible ability to learn an effective and democratic governance system. Recently it has also demonstrated to have a well discipline and professional army and security services in fighting the ISIS. On the other side ongoing disagreement with Iraqi central government on funding and on sharing of oil production revenue are harming the sustainability of all achievements as well as affecting Kurdistan to achieve its development potential.

attributes.action: We ask for an independent review of the validity of the EU referendum franchise.
attributes.background: Many UK expats were disenfranchised from the referendum, violating Art.21 of the UN Declaration on Human Rights. We call for an independent inquiry into the validity of the referendum electoral roll and for further government consideration of EU exit to be postponed until its finding is made public.
attributes.additional_details: UK expatriate citizens residing abroad for 15 years or more were excluded from voting in the EU referendum, in contravention of their human rights, as laid out in Article 21 of the United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights of December 10, 1948 (General Assembly resolution 217(III) A). We believe this disenfranchisement to be unacceptable, since these UK citizens are among the most directly and adversely affected by the referendum outcome.

attributes.action: Change NHS sight tests to meet the needs of people with learning disabilities
attributes.background: There are huge levels of sight problems amongst people with learning disabilities but they suffer unequal access to eye care. This is leaving many people with poor vision or even tragically losing their sight.
attributes.additional_details: The charity SeeAbility is calling for national pathways of eye care for people with learning disabilities, including for children in special schools, and for all working age adults with learning disabilities to be eligible for NHS funded sight tests. People are likely to need additional time or appointments to complete a sight test. This requires the Department of Health and NHS England to change the statutory and funding framework for NHS sight tests, to deliver an equal right to sight.

attributes.action: Reconsider debating ignored petition on Jeremy Hunt signed by 330k

attributes.action: Allow the ownership of handguns in the UK

attributes.action: Explain why FCO 30/1048 was withheld from the British public for 30 years
attributes.background: In 1971, an FCO memorandum known as FCO 30/1048 was drafted. This document details how the UK would surrender sovereignty if it were to join the E.E.C/EU. However, this document was classified as Confidential, and not released into the public domain until 2002.
attributes.additional_details:
The surrender of sovereign powers, as a consequence of signing the Treaty of Rome, Maastricht, and Lisbon, is in breach of the British constitution, as detailed in the Bill of Rights 1688.

This Bill has never been repealed, and as such was and is still in force. The contents of FCO 30/1048, and the effect to UK sovereignty, were not made available to the British public during the 1975 referendum.

References:
Bill of Rights 1688
FCO 30/1048
Treaty of Rome
Maastricht Treaty
Lisbon Treaty

attributes.action: We want RM stonehouse to be kept open it's the  spiritual home and HQ for RM
attributes.background: The government  recently announced that Stonehouse was being put up for sale. Stonehouse is the spiritual embodiment of the Royal Marines  and three commando Brigade is the Royal marines home  and shouldn't be sold for housing it is a listed building that has a lots of heart and history.
attributes.additional_details:
The earliest parts of Stonehouse Barracks date from 1756 The buildings immediately became the headquarters of the Plymouth Division of the Royal Marines. Although the divisional structure of the Royal Marines was dismantled during the Second World War, the barracks remain in use as headquarters of 3 Commando Brigade. 
It is also home to the globe theatre a beautiful music hall. 
As a whole, Stonehouse is described as "the oldest and most important group of barracks in England not forming part of a fortification, a very rare example of C18 planning, and a complex of great historic value
